snippet.description:
A description of planar graph duality, and how it can be applied in a particularly elegant proof of Euler's Characteristic Formula.

Music: Wyoming 307 by Time For Three
snippet.title: Euler's Formula and Graph Duality

snippet.description: A teaser for some future videos regarding a pattern which lures an unsuspecting doodler into thinking it will be powers of two.
snippet.title: A Curious Pattern Indeed

snippet.description:
Steven Strogatz and I talk about a famous historical math problem, a clever solution, and a modern twist.

snippet.title: The Brachistochrone, with Steven Strogatz

snippet.description:
New version with improved audio: https://youtu.be/3s7h2MHQtxc

Space filling curves, turning visual information into audio information, and the connection between infinite and finite math. 

For more information on sight-via sound, this paper is particularly thought provoking:

Von Melchner, Laurie, Sarah L. Pallas, and Mriganka Sur. "Visual behaviour mediated by retinal projections directed to the auditory pathway." Nature 404.6780 (2000): 871-876.

or this NYT summary: 

http://www.nytimes.com/2000/04/25/science/rewired-ferrets-overturn-theories-of-brain-growth.html

Also check out this excellent podcast on Human echo-location:

http://www.npr.org/programs/invisibilia/378577902/how-to-become-batman

For anyone curious to read more about the connections between infinite and finite math, consider this Terry Tao blog post:

https://terrytao.wordpress.com/2007/05/23/soft-analysis-hard-analysis-and-the-finite-convergence-principle/

snippet.description: This is a supplement to the Brachistochrone video, proving Snell's law with a clever little argument by Mark Levi.
snippet.title: Snell's law proof using springs

snippet.description:
An explanation of a neat circle puzzle involving combinatorics, graphs, Euler's characteristic formula and pascal's triangle.

Music: Wyoming 307 by Time for Three
snippet.title: Circle Division Solution

snippet.description: A montage of space filling curves, meant as a supplement to the Hilbert curve video.
snippet.title: Fractal charm: Space filling curves

snippet.description:
An exploration of infinite sums, from convergent to divergent, including a brief introduction to the 2-adic metric, all themed on that cycle between discovery and invention in math.

Music: Legions (Reverie) by Zoe Keating
